title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Jasmine Arbor, from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]", 1821–24
medium:
Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, graphite, red crayon on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper
Support: paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite on mount, lower center:  Jasmin
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer A. Samuels, New York.
description: Scene in walled garden dominated by a jasime arbor in the left middleground.  A gardener on a ladder pins part of the jasmin vine to the trellis.  In the right background, a male gardener with hoe tends floral beds.  Seated under the arbor, a man and a woman smell a bunch of jasmin held by a small boy.  Two pots of jasmine sit on a low wall, left foreground; a watering can lies on its side, lower right foreground.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Plate Design:  Jasmine Arbor, from the Service de la Culture des Fleurs [Flower Cultivation Service]", 1821–24. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, graphite, red crayon on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper
Support: paper. 1989-13-5.
